communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: KWW Model Policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

RCW 43.10.310(2)(b) states that public schools, health facilities, and courthouses must notify the attorney general if it "is not adopting the changes to its policies consistent with the model policy, state the reasons that the agency is not adopting the changes, and provide the attorney general with a copy of the agency's policies."

Please provide all such notifications received by the AG's office since January 1, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: 15-183051
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting any and all records, information, data, photos, investigative notes, logs, presentations, communications, written notes, documentation, documents, official emails, and any public or print media associated with the disappearance and subsequent missing persons investigation of Michael Alan Sutherland on June 26, 2015.

Relevant identifiers include:

Agency Case Number: 15-183051

NamUs ID: MP29283

If portions of the requested records are exempt from disclosure, I request that you provide all information that can be released, with only the legally necessary redactions applied.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Simon A.

title: Reports regarding display of U.S. flag and recitation of Pledge of Allegiance (August 2025)

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Reports regarding display of U.S. flag and recitation of Pledge of Allegiance (August 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Each "report detailing [a district's] policies regarding the display of the U.S. flag and the weekly recitation of the Pledge of Allegiance," including the "specific measures the district has implemented to ensure compliance and how these practices are being integrated into the school culture," as required by the August 29, 2024, press release from Ryan Walter, State Superintendent of Public Instruction, concerning "Guidelines of Patriotic Displays."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Request for BWC Footage – Case No. 05-2024-MM-051729-AXXX-BC (MPD Case No. 2024-00154075)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for BWC Footage – Case No. 05-2024-MM-051729-AXXX-BC (MPD Case No. 2024-00154075)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

To the Melbourne Police Department Public Records Unit:

This request is made pursuant to the Florida Public Records Law, Chapter 119, Florida Statutes.

I am requesting the primary officer’s body-worn camera (BWC) footage related to the incident that occurred on October 23, 2024 in Melbourne, Brevard County, Florida, involving the following individual:

Defendant: Alvinique Sapp (DOB: 06/18/1985)

Court Case No.: 05-2024-MM-051729-AXXX-BC

Police Department Case No.: 2024-00154075

Please include the primary officer’s BWC footage covering the entire incident, from the time officers arrived on scene until all suspects were taken into custody and placed in police vehicles.

If any portion of the requested footage is exempt from disclosure, please cite the specific statutory exemption and release every reasonably segregable non-exempt portion. Where redactions are necessary, kindly provide a written explanation of the legal basis for each redaction.

Thank you for your assistance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

William Benjamin Johnson

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: TX mDL Program Records (Jan 2023–Present)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Planning documents, feasibility studies, pilot proposals, implementation roadmaps, and any vendor marketing materials or brochures provided to the agency, as well as internal deliberations about whether or how to move forward with an mDL program, created between January 1, 2023 and the present.

Agreements, contracts, or memoranda of understanding with vendors or partners, including but not limited to AAMVA, IDEMIA, Thales, GET Group, Apple, Google, Samsung, or other providers.

Interagency or interstate coordination documents, including but not limited to MOUs or correspondence with AAMVA or other states or Dallas/Fort Worth Int’l Airport regarding mDL interoperability or standards development.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Williams

title: Any usage of FTI for AI disclosures sent to the Office of Safeguards 4/14-Present

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Any usage of FTI for AI disclosures sent to the Office of Safeguards 4/14-Present
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any emails, memorandum, or other documentation sent to the Office of Safeguards re: the usage of FTI for Artificial Intelligence (AI) purposes by ICE between the dates of 4/14/2025 to present/

Records Source: The MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING BETWEEN U.S. TREASURY DEPARTMENT on behalf of the INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE AND U.S. DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND SECURITY on behalf of the U.S. IMMIGRATION AND CUSTOMS ENFORCEMENT, FOR THE EXCHANGE OF INFORMATION FOR NONTAX CRIMINAL ENFORCEMENT requires the "Usage of FTI for Artificial Intelligence (AI) purposes must be disclosed to the Office of Safeguards for assessment of compliance with safeguard requirements."* 

Time Period: I am requesting any documentation sent in the last two weeks to keep this request narrow and timely. 

Expedited Processing: I request  expedited processing of this request because there is an urgent compelling need to inform the public of the policies and decision-making regarding the ICE analysis of FTI for immigration policy implementation. Politicians on both sides of the aisle have also called attention to excessive use of sensitive data by this administration. For example, on April 9, 18 Senators wrote to the Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration (TIGTA) investingdation access to ICE access of taxpayer information.**

* Source: https://files.epi.org/uploads/IRS_ICE_MOU-April-2025.pdf
** Source: https://www.taxnotes.com/research/federal/legislative-documents/congressional-tax-correspondence/senators-seek-investigation-ice-access-taxpayer-info/7rys7

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Williams

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Internal evaluation or pilot assessment reports that summarize performance, adoption, risks, or “lessons learned” from the mDL program, as well as documents that explain, evaluate, or justify why the program was paused, suspended, decommissioned, or otherwise put on hold (including budgetary, technical, policy, or accessibility issues), and any materials discussing the possibility of resuming or reactivating the program.

Agreements, contracts, or memoranda of understanding with vendors or partners, including but not limited to IDEMIA, AAMVA, Apple, Google, Samsung, or other providers.

Interagency or interstate coordination documents, including but not limited to MOUs or correspondence with AAMVA or other states regarding mDL interoperability, standards development, or airport integration at Will Rogers World Airport.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: TSA Biometric Pilot Records – JFK (Expedited Request)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

created between March 1, 2025 and August 30, 2025 related to TSA biometric pilots at John F. Kennedy International Airport (JFK):

(1) Internal evaluation or pilot assessment reports prepared by TSA program offices (e.g., Requirements & Capabilities Analysis or CAT Program Office) that summarize performance, risks, or “lessons learned” from biometric deployments at JFK (Touchless ID, CAT-2, or eGates).

(2) Agreements with private vendors (such as CLEAR, IDEMIA, or similar) governing biometric deployments at JFK during this timeframe, including MOUs, pilot participation agreements, or Other Transaction Agreements (OTAs).

I request expedited processing under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E) and 6 C.F.R. § 5.5(e), as there is an urgent need to inform the public about TSA’s expansion of biometric surveillance at one of the nation’s busiest airports. Millions of travelers are affected, and timely disclosure is essential for public oversight and debate.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Williams

title: NY PACER Access & Contract for ICE

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NY PACER Access & Contract for ICE
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On 7/23/2025 there was a Final Purchase made by ICE to the PACER SERVICE CENTER for $11,000. The description of requirement is "This award provides officers in the Enforcement and Removal Operations New York City Area access to Public Access to Court Electronic Records to assist in rendering case decisions. This modification exercises and funds option period 4."

I am requesting the following documents relating to this specific transaction:
1) All conformed contracts, agreements, and legal/procurement agreements between Immigrations and Customs Enforcement and Pacer. 
2) All PACER invoices and lists of related queries (if provided as part of the PACER invoice) 
3) All documents pertaining to live monitoring, alerts, alert configurations, API configurations, and other alert systems ICE uses through PACER (if any exist) 

Thank you in advance for your time.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: Public Records Request Log - West Virginia Department of Environmental Protection

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Public Records Request Log - West Virginia Department of Environmental Protection
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

> A dataset (CSV or Excel preferred) containing all effluent exceedances and Clean Water Act violations reported through the eDMR system for NPDES-permitted facilities in the state of West Virginia from 2020 through 2025. 

Please include, if available:
- Facility name
- NPDES permit number
- Monitoring period (start and end dates)
- Pollutant or parameter exceeded
- Reported value and permitted limit
- Violation classification
- Enforcement action taken (if applicable)
- County or facility location

I am requesting these records for research and educational purposes and respectfully request a waiver of any applicable fees. If fees are expected to exceed $50, please notify me in advance.

I am requesting this information in digital format and prefer delivery via email or secure file download link.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Amelia Minder

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the Manchester Police Department’s Flock Safety system, specifically:

CONTRACTS and AGREEMENTS
• All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents with Flock Safety that were active any time between 1/1/2025 and to the date this request is processed.  This includes documentation related to the acquisition, leasing, or use of Flock Safety cameras or services, including data platforms or analytics tools.

GUIDING DOCUMENTATION and POLICIES
• All policies, memorandums of understanding, and other guidance materials generated by this agency and/or entity operating on its behalf regarding the acquisition and use of any data or services provided by Flock Safety and any representative thereof or any subdivision thereof. Responsive materials include, but are not limited to, any data-sharing agreements,  training materials, or other guidance materials.
• This should also include, but is not limited to, policies, records, or data related to sharing of passwords or access with local, regional, or federal task forces or agents.

USAGE DATA
1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of 1/1/2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of 1/1/2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide any documents in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide PDF, CSV, or spreadsheet files where applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ryan Brooks

title: CIA support for upcoming film "Hotel Tehran"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CIA support for upcoming film "Hotel Tehran"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) and the production of upcoming movie "Hotel Tehran" directed by Guy Moshe. Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of CIA and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Hotel Tehran," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Request to NASA for 2024 annual budget of office of Multimedia Liaison for Film and TV Collaborations

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to NASA for 2024 annual budget of office of Multimedia Liaison for Film and TV Collaborations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All annual budget reports for the office of NASA's Multimedia Liaison for Film and TV Collaborations, for the year 2024. 

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies," and I have used documents released to me by NASA via FOIA in published research articles. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Police Observation Device Request (Sacramento Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request photos, videos, or any other available documentation for the police observation device stationed at K street and 10th street in Sacramento. Please provide the content for the morning of 8/29/2025, 5am to 7am.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Rodriguez
